title: Insider: Patriots probably won’t make a ‘Micah Parsons-type’ trade this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots likely won't trade major draft capital for a star player this offseason, according to ESPN's Mike Reiss.
New England is interested in Eagles' A.J. Brown and Raiders' Maxx Crosby but balks at high trade demands.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasizes building through the draft, with the Patriots holding 11 picks in the 2026 NFL Draft.

title: Largest energy storage facility statewide gets approved for construction in Everett
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jupiter Power receives approval to build Massachusetts' largest battery storage system on a former ExxonMobil site in Everett.
The facility spans 16.5 acres and includes 816 lithium-ion battery enclosures and two substations interconnecting with Eversource Mystic.
The project is part of Everett's larger Docklands development, featuring mixed-use space including residential, lab, and retail areas.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Connor Storrie hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Connor Storrie hosted 'SNL' on February 28, featuring Mumford & Sons as the musical guest.
Hudson Williams joined Storrie in a skating sketch and helped introduce Mumford & Sons.
US Olympic hockey team members appeared during the monologue, including Megan Keller and Hilary Knight.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s loss against the Red Bulls
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution lost 1-0 to New York Red Bulls, with a decisive goal by Julian Hall.
Revolution struggled with possession against New York's high press, impacting play and passing accuracy.
New England's best chance came in the second half but was missed due to lack of coordination.

title: Triston Casas reportedly unlikely to be ready by Opening Day, while Kutter Crawford, Patrick Sandoval take step forward in rehab
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox first baseman Triston Casas is unlikely to be ready for Opening Day after tearing his patellar tendon in 2025.
Pitchers Kutter Crawford and Patrick Sandoval have made progress in rehab, each recently participating in live batting practice.
Despite injuries, both Crawford and Sandoval are hopeful but not certain to be ready for the Red Sox's Opening Day roster.

title: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to enforce illegal passing laws
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Chicopee installs security cameras on school bus stop arms to deter illegal passing of stopped buses.
The cameras, partnered with BusPatrol, record violations and issue citations, enhancing enforcement without police presence.
The initiative follows a law signed in 2025, allowing camera use for student safety without city costs.

title: Review and setlist: Chris Stapleton brings the blues to Mohegan Sun Arena
author: Chris Stevens
bullets: Chris Stapleton performed to a sold-out audience at Mohegan Sun Arena, featuring a mix of blues and ballads.
The performance included hits like "Tennessee Whiskey" and "What Am I Gonna Do," and Stapleton showcased his guitar skills.
Legendary musicians like pedal steel player Paul Franklin and keyboardist Lee Pardini joined Stapleton on stage.

title: 8 possible cut or trade candidates for Patriots ahead of NFL free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Stefon Diggs could be cut to save the Patriots $16.8 million, despite being a key target for QB Drake Maye.
Patriots may consider cutting receivers DeMario Douglas, Mack Hollins, or Kayshon Boutte, saving up to $4 million each.
Christian Elliss and Garrett Bradbury are potential cut candidates, potentially saving millions in cap space for the Patriots.

title: Jayson Tatum won’t make return from Achilles tear in Celtics’ matchup vs. 76ers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jayson Tatum will not return for the Celtics' game against the 76ers on Sunday due to a lingering Achilles injury.
Philadelphia 76ers' center Joel Embiid will miss Sunday's game because of an oblique strain, affecting the team's next three games.
The Celtics, currently second in the East, have won 8 of their last 10 games and will face Philadelphia for the series finale.

title: Jarren Duran’s hot start to spring training continues, hitting 2 homers vs. Twins. What could it mean for Red Sox’ lineup?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jarren Duran hit three home runs in the first week of spring training, including two against left-handed pitchers.
Duran has improved performance against lefties, batting .583 with two homers in recent Red Sox spring training games.
Duran's hot start raises his potential to secure the designated hitter role and the three spot in the Red Sox lineup.
